Description: Textile fragment of front or back of an originally sleeved tunic; (a) Main textile of undyed, plain weave linen, undecorated apart from groups of self stripes; Seam at waist and cut-out oval neck line; Applied, woollen tapestry decoration of two types: (b) clavi or shoulder stripes and (c) broad hem border; (a) warp: S spun, 11-12 tpc; (a) weft: S spun, c.16 tpc; Edges: two selvedges in waist seam, selvedge at hem, other edges ragged; Sewing: S spun, Z ply linen thread, waist seam-'run and fell' (back stitch then overcasting), hem-overcast, side seam-run and fell, decoration-cut edges turned under, overcast onto (a). (b) Two broad, full-length clavi or shoulder stripes with woollen, tapestry (plied warp threads) decoration; Main design, standing human figures in oblong red panels (c.15x5.5cm) flanked on the left by plants and on the right by debased letters; The figures, having brightly-coloured decorated clothing, hair of various shades, hold a sceptre in raised left hand, and probably represent warrior saints; Elongated and stylised, with much outlining (not soumak); Inner border of petals or leaves; Outer border stepped; Clavi extend under hem border almost to hem itself; (b) warp: linen, S spun, Z ply, c.7-8 tpc; (b) weft: wool and linen, S spun, c.35 tpc; Edges: hidden (cut) or ragged. (c) Band of woollen, tapestry (plied warp threads) applied to hem of plain weave, linen tunic with two smaller pieces returning up side seam; Large-scale lozenge or trellis design (lozenges 15x18cm); Red ground, multicoloured triple bars, with rosettes at junctions, enclose a slightly varying stylised plant motif in a predominantly green and greeny-yellow; (c) warp: linen, S spun, Z ply, c.9 tpc; (c) weft: wool and linen, S spun, c.35 tpc; Edges: edges parallel to warp are mainly selvedges, other edges cut.
Curator's comments: Previous location in David Thompson's room, 1-1A Montague St; Complete width of body would be c.92cm, tucks at sides of waist seam adjusted the hem length; Lozenge design is comparatively late date; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (30.11.1989)
Condition: Unknown dates stuck to sticky net; (a) Medium, good in places; (b) Medium, wool in many places disappeared, where it survives, colour good; (c) Medium, wool has mostly disappeared
Acquisition notes: Collection purchased at sale on 6th Dec 1954, lots 154, 155 and 156.
